review: I bought the fire stick for my parents. It is easy to set up and use, but it took awhile to figure out that you have to log a credit card on the Amazon website in order to utilize Netflix even if you already have a Netflix subscription.  It is definitely easy to use and my parents have been enjoying it.

author: Amazon Customer

review: Product has to be registered. Would not recognize my Amazon account. After hours on the phone trying to resolve the problem, the representative told me she was passing it on to the "tech" department. After two days, the has been no communication. I'm sure the product is good, but the service is awful at best.
author: Woodrow T. Parker

review: Nice streaming stick but the network connectivity seems to be a bit flaky. My chromecast never has a problem with the network dropping out, even though it is in the same location behind my tv as the amazon stick.The interface is confusing and difficult to find things to watch, even if you know what you want. Netflix experience is great until the network drops, at which point I need to do a hard reset and remove the power.Biggest annoyance is that you cant turn it off unless you unplug the power source. The stick eventually falls asleep (screen goes black).
author: Billy-Bob

review: Fire TV Stick is a great concept. I personally had some challenges connecting up with my TV and local Cable set-up but that's not a Fire Stick problem but a matter of so many remotes to juggle switching back and forth from cable to amazon movies. in the Fire TV Stick package the greatest was the physical difficulty of opening the remote to add batteries. I found the case release required a lot of carefully applied pressure to get a release. It shouldn't be forced or pried open but I've certainly seen better designed release mechanisms that require batteries. Once you get past these challenges for your unique set up, the actual movie experience layout is quite nice and you can start watching films.
